page.title: 11PLANT LIFE IN BEWCASTLE
page.content: The plant life of this area reflects the fact that it is a region quite far north and a fair height above sea level and gets a high rainfall (about 120 cms per year).Much of the higher land has been planted with coniferous forest which stifles the lower level growth and the lower land has been drained and reseeded for pasture and hay crops , so the natural vegetation is largely absent from these areas. However, between the two is less well cared for land where many plants flourish and the hedgerows of the lanes are veritable gardens.Among the plants are:- foxglove,buttercup, daisy ,dandelion,cowslip,marigold,violet, herb robert,celandine,orchid,primrose, gorse, elder,hazel, thistle, stitchwort, speedwell, bluebell, garlic, willowherb and many others.
